div.l: Ȝut say I neủer by my fader kynne4038
How þat þᵉ hopeer waggeth to ⁊and fro
Aleyn answered Iohn wylt þᵘou so4040
Þanne wyl I be benethe by my crowne
And se how þat þᵉ mele falleth adowne
In to þᵉ trowh þᵗat shal be my desport
For Iohn in feyth I may be of ȝoure sort
I am as ille a myller as ben ȝe4045
Þis myller smyled of her nycete
And þouth all þis is done for a wyle
Þei wene þᵗat no man may hem begyle
But by my þrift ȝut shall I blere her eye
For al þᵉ sleyth in her filosophie4050
Þᵉ mo queynte crekes þᵗat þei make
Þᵉ more wyl I stele when I take
In stede of floure ȝut wyl I ȝeue hem bren
Þᵉ grettest clerk beth not þᵉ wysest maenclerkes not þᵉ wysest menclerk beth not þᵉ wysest man
And þen he goþ vnto þᵉ mare4055
Of al her art ȝeue I not a tare
Out of þᵉ dore he goth ful pⁱriuely
When he saw his tyme softely
He loketh vp ⁊and doun tyl he haue founde
Þᵉ clerkes hors þ̉ere as he stod ybounde4060
Byhynde þᵉ mylle vndeer a lefsell
And to þᵉ hors he goth fayre ⁊and well
He strypeth of þᵉ bridell þ̉ere anon
And whenne þᵉ hors was lose he begynneth to gon
Toward þᵉ fenne þ̉ere wylde mares renne
And forth goth he þoruh þikke ⁊and þoruh þinne
Þᵉ myller goth aȝeyn no word he seyde4067
